metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3567 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in Caribou due to a regression of CVE-2020-25712 fix. An attacker could use this flaw to bypass screen-locking applications that leverage Caribou as an input mechanism. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to system availability.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3567` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

caribou - 0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
caribou-antler - 0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
gir1.2-caribou-1.0 - 0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
libcaribou-common - 0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
libcaribou-gtk-module - 0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
libcaribou-gtk3-module - 0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
libcaribou0 - 0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: caribou package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.4.21-7ubuntu0.20.04.1').
